text: It is said that Azazel’s beauty is second only to that of Slaanesh himself, and those who gaze upon him cannot gainsay such claims. As the Prince of Damnation prowls the mortal plane, his arrival is met by the usual fanfare he has become accustomed to, the barbarians of the Steppes fling themselves at his feet as they wail and proclaim their allegiance and love. Yet this time the world must take heed, for the darkling monster’s appearance is a portent most dire. Deep within the psyche of the other three Powers has always lurked the suspicion that Slaanesh’s influence could one day eclipse them all. By the might of His Ecstatic Legions, that day is nigh.

From the day Doctor Festus’ brilliant mortal mind suffered its horrific awakening, the vagaries of fate had oft twisted in his favour. Never is the Leechlord happier than when planting Nurgle’s seeds of malady across the world, force-feeding his vile experimental concoctions to the many unfortunates who stray into his path. Yet soon shall be the dawn of a far greater opportunity for mass infection; the unleashing of a dark power so great, it shall be thirsted after by the Gods themselves. A means for the Doctor and his Patron to spread unbound life – and death – into the material realm on an unimaginable scale.

The annals of history recall many of Valkia the Bloody’s appearances in the world, her arrival always met with fear but also reverence from the faithful of the Blood God who worship her as a goddess. And now the Consort of Khorne comes to blight the mortal plane once again, this time her coming foretold many years in advance by tribal shamans, with the iconic and primitive etchings of the winged warrior-queen long adorning the walls of hermit grottos across the north. As the world teeters on the precipice of epochal events, Khorne’s bloodlust crescendos once more, His violent whims, as ever, to be served unquestioningly by the inimitable Gorequeen.

What is the true purpose of those who serve within Tzeentch’s schemes? The answer eludes Vilitch the Curseling no less than his Master’s other puppets. Legitimised long ago as a horribly remarkable agent of Change by the Great Conspirator himself, the disturbing creature known as the Twisted Twin acts with inscrutable intent, leading his hard-bitten host through warpaths of misrule, disorder and death. As the fate of a lesser god draws to its conclusion, the Sorcerer-runt is soon to turn his attention back north, where broils something ancient and potent deep within the Wastes. Most importantly, a rare chance to secure favour in the eyes of his master and perhaps never be forsaken again…

A champion rises, chief among the armies of Ruin! With all challengers vanquished, and the souls of Zanbaijin claimed, a true paragon of Chaos has emerged. There is surely now no force in any realm capable of barring the path to total domination! The whole of the mortal plane shall soon quake in abject terror, for where the Altar of Battle's eternal champion goes, a legacy of pure destruction is sure to follow close behind...

The name Astragoth Ironhand is legendary amongst the Dhrath-Zharr, powerful, loyal and zealous acolytes of Hashut. But that was many years ago, and the rigors of time and Dark Magic hardened the Sorcerer-Prophet’s limbs until they turned to stone. Not resigned to becoming a statue, he forged a suit of machinery in which to continue his work.\\n\\nCarried by his own designs and dark intellect, Astragoth Ironhand now travels freely, relying on his own twisted science and construction to convey him.\\n\\nUpstarts may now see him as a fossil, a remnant embedded in stone and well beyond his prime, but Astragoth’s time is not yet over! Age and petrification are mere obstacles to overcome, and with the fabled Blood of Hashut, this domination will be secured!

In his youth, the fearsome Daemonsmith Drazhoath lost favour amongst the Sorcerer-Prophets, a victim of the savage politics of Zharr-Naggrund. For this, he was exiled from the heart of the Chaos Dwarf empire to the Black Fortress, in the distant reaches south of the Mountains of Mourn.\\n\\nDrazhoath has since risen to become Lord of the Black Fortress and Commander of the Legion of Azgorh from his border citadel near the banks of the mighty River Ruin. Looking again to the Tower of Fire, he seeks revenge against those that exiled him.\\n\\nA method for Drazhoath the Ashen to return home now presents itself, not as a penitent pilgrim, but as the rightful and irrefutably brutal Lord of Zharr-Naggrund.

Ghorth the Cruel, Sorcerer-Prophet of Zharr-Naggrund, demands much from his generals. Fresh Labourers are required daily to meet the harsh demands of the Chaos Dwarf’s vast factory forges. No Dhrath-Zharr would accept this task more gladly, or with darker, even crueller glee, than Zhatan the Black, Commander of the Tower of Zharr.\\n\\nA call from Ghorth for even greater harvests reaches Zhatan; rumblings of a new venture are heard. The challenge is welcomed: new lands will be conquered for the glory of Hashut and Ghorth, and the weak will be inevitably subsumed.\\n\\nThe screams of the weak will echo throughout the forges, and the ecstatic laughs of Zhatan shall ring out all the louder!

The Jade Dragon, architect of the Dragon Emperor’s vision for Grand Cathay and Lord of the Jade Court, is a master of many disciplines; administration, record keeping, magic and espionage.\\n\\nFrom the trade city of Shang-Wu, he plans the prosperity of the entire realm. But now, the time for overt action is at hand. The Dragon Emperor himself has tasked Yuan Bo with fulfilling a centuries-long scheme to ensure Cathay’s prominence. This must be attended to personally. No other faithful servant of the Dragon Emperor can be trusted with this undertaking.\\n\\nAnd so, Yuan Bo must step out from the shadows and take to the field. With the accumulated knowledge of the Jade Court, Yuan Bo seeks to realign the Celestial Compass, and secure the safety of Grand Cathay from all dangers, either within or without.

In Kislev, children both rich and poor are scared into obedience with whispers of the dreaded hag in the woods. Yet the reality is far more horrifying than any child could conceive, for the old crone spoken about in such tales is no mere myth.\\n\\nMother Ostankya, an elusive figure empowered by the land itself, draws her terrifying magic from woodland, fen and oblast alike. Those with transgressions against the Motherland, be they of this world or another, find no refuge from her vengeance, even on their own soil.\\n\\nTo the distant north, where stands Kislev’s abandoned watchtowers against the Ruinous incursions, she brings her wrath. There can be no doubt: her appearance so far from home is a portent of terrible curses soon to come.\\n\\n[[i]]Mother Ostankya will get you![[/i]]

An eternity of meddling in the Chaos Realm inevitably led Tzeentch’s brother-Gods to vie for the Changeling’s destruction.\\n\\nFor it was the Changeling who cut away Slaanesh’s hair as the Dark Prince slept to weave a cloak presented to a champion of Tzeentch. It was the Changeling who sealed the doors of Khorne’s citadel while he was campaigning, forcing the Blood God to shatter his own proud gates when he returned.\\n\\nYet it is the Daemon’s boredom with such inanities of the Great Game, rather than the ire of the Chaos Realm, that leads him to the Old World to seek greater tapestries of disruption. By the time the deceiving horror becomes known to his victims, be they kings, emperors, or even gods, they will be impotent to act against him.

After multiple tragedies born of miscalculation and catastrophic failure, the blood on Malakai Makaisson's hands will not be easy to wipe clean. Ejected from the Engineers' Guild, the eager inventor plies his trade as a sworn Slayer, hoping his work can be of some use until he finds redemption in glorious sacrifice.\\n\\nYet, as the oncoming tides of Chaos threaten to swallow the world whole, his noble demise may lie just beyond the horizon. Aboard the Spirit of Grungni – an Airship of his own design – he traverses the skies, honour-bound to defend the Dwarfholds with his most deadly creations.\\n\\nFor now, Makaisson's calling draws him onwards. There await the hordes of Chaos, and the chance to reclaim the respect of his people and erase his shame once and for all!

An ancient prophecy foretells of a vile and deathly force of Chaos, led by a monstrous champion capable of uniting the armies of their wretched God to conquer the unholy proving ground of Zanbaijin. Now, legend sits on the verge of reality. Tamurkhan, the great Kurgan Lord of Chaos, has declared himself the fabled Bringer of Desolation, seeking to lead the virulent war hosts of Nurgle in a sweeping tide of rot.\\n\\nBurrowed deep in the body of an Ogre Tyrant, he puppets his hideous host with the blessing of the Urfather, riding before his great horde to spread death and destruction in abundance. The misguided pawns of lesser Gods will no doubt try to stand in his way – a mistake the Maggot Lord will make sure to punish severely!

Your father and mother – the Dragon Emperor and Moon Empress – have been missing for over a century. It is the Time of Darkness and Disharmony. Unrest is rife. Your siblings look to their own affairs, caring not that the hordes of Chaos mass just beyond the Great Bastion. But even on this side of the barrier the cults of Chi’an Chi foster dissention. The coming conflict will be difficult without aid, so perhaps the Ogres will side with you for a large fee? Or maybe your younger brother, the Iron Dragon, can be convinced to send the legions of Shang-yang? Harmony must be restored… and soon… or Grand Cathay will fall.

Grand Cathay is the land of the Celestial Dragon Emperor. Before the world was blighted by Chaos, the Celestial Dragon learned how to take human form. To aid his rule, he took a mate, the Moon Dragon, and they had nine children who became noble rulers of Cathay's many provinces.\\n\\nOf the nine, four have been lost to time and enmity. Miao Ying, the Storm Dragon, was the first-born, given the honour of ruling the Northern Provinces and charged with Cathay's defence as commander of the Great Bastion. But the predations of Chaos grow, the bastion is under strain.\\n\\nThe power of a god may aid in securing Cathay's borders. Perhaps there is an opportunity to lure the Storm Dragon into the Chaos Realms? I travel east to gain an audience.

The Dragon Emperor and Moon Empress have been missing for over a century, and your siblings seem distracted. You have been left to your own devices – a chance to expand your power base without interference perhaps? However, your spies in Nan-Gau bring dire tidings that the legions of Chaos muster beyond the Great Bastion in numbers not seen in generations. Your older sister will no doubt try and defend the walls alone, but why should her pride deprive Cathay of your alchemical insights? Perhaps your status will be enhanced upon your father’s inevitable return should you make a direct intervention in the realm’s defence? Then again, if the Storm Dragon fails, she will have further to fall...

Grand Cathay is the land of the Celestial Dragon Emperor. In the distant past the Dragon Emperor founded his domain amongst the human tribes who dwelt in the east. To aid his rule, he took a mate, the Moon Dragon, and they had nine children who became noble rulers of Cathay's many provinces.\\n\\nOf the nine, four have been lost to time and enmity. Zhao Ming, the Iron Dragon, is closer to his mother and perceived with suspicion by his siblings. He rules Western Cathay yet the Skaven that lurk in the Warpstone Desert have been emboldened of late.\\n\\nThe power of a god may aid in pacifying his regions, increasing his standing amongst his kin. Will such a prize lure him into the Chaos Realms? I travel east to gain an audience.

The god-slayer is returned back to the mortal plane, forever changed. And now the Dark Powers circle around him like carrion, each vying for the prize – of yoking this Daemon Prince to their servitude. Until then, they offer him gifts and servants of his own, and so he raises an army that serves no single God – a Legion of Chaos.\\n\\nYet even as he's courted by the Dark Powers, there is a greater bounty found in the Chaos Realms.\\n\\nI do not need to travel far to find the Daemon Prince and make my offer. Already, he lays the foundations to a new fortress from which he will cast a reign of terror.

Weakness cannot be abided, and Grand Cathay is weak. The Dragon Emperor and his consort have fled their thrones; their scions are meek and must be destroyed. The other gods wish a share of the spoils, but do not let that distract you. Dominate the mortal and Daemonic legions, break through the dam, and flood the eastern lands in blood. Most importantly of all, bring Khorne the skulls of the Dragon-children and he may yet forgive you.

No subtlety, has Khorne. He yearns only for battle – slaughter is his desire, blood to sate an unquenchable thirst, and skulls to pile about his throne. Skarbrand was the most worthy of Khorne's Bloodthirsters, the greatest of the Blood God's reapers. But that was before his exile, cast from Khorne's presence, and now he finds himself on the wrong side of the maelstrom in the aftermath of Ursun's roar.\\n\\nBut there is a way for the Greater Daemon to find favour with his master again. Guided by the tome, I travel across the Chaos Wastes, through jagged mountains and lava rivers to Skarbrand's lair... Infernius.

Heretics spew forth across the land. This is what the Great Orthodoxy always feared would happen, and why the godless and unbelievers were excised, but it seems even that was not enough!\\n\\nThe cults of the Kislev pantheon were united under the Great Orthodoxy, and so must its sovereigns be also. Find common cause with Katarin and her father, the Red Tzar, for that is what Ursun demands. Only then can Kislev be purged of Chaos filth! Arm the faithful and unleash them – for Kislev and the Great Bear!

Kislev. The bulwark against the darkness. It is Kislevite blood that has protected the Old World, and yet where is their gratitude?\\n\\nSuch sermons are preached by the Supreme Patriarch of the Ursunite Cult, and Leader of the Great Orthodoxy, Kostaltyn. But who do they put upon the throne? A child. The daughter of the Red Tzar has fallen to the heresies of the Ice Witches. If Kostaltyn is to save Ursun, to step into the Chaos Realms, then the Supreme Patriarch must take control of the Motherland and have a united nation at his back.\\n\\nI journey to him now; he prays at a sacred site hidden by the Orthodoxy... the resting place of Boris Ursus.

Chaos spills forth, befouling the oblasts of Kislev, corrupting and slaying your subjects. The nation and your reign are in peril. The Empire revels in its own strife so it is up to you to act. However, there are unlikely allies: rumours persist that your father, the Red Tzar, strides across Kislev once again, and even the Great Orthodoxy makes overtures to face the greater threat.\\n\\nNow is the time to fight. Take back the oblasts from the Daemons and you will be remembered as the greatest of Khan-Queens!

Kislev. A realm forged by the Khan Queens of old. The bulwark against the darkness. The living bastion that protects the Empire and the soft nations to the south.\\n\\nSince her father's death, Katarin has taken the throne, but there are many within the realm who resent her rule, even now, the power of the Great Orthodoxy rises against the Ice Queen. If she is to save Ursun, to step beyond her borders and into the Chaos Realms, Katarin must have a united nation at her back.\\n\\nI journey to her now, across the icy fringes, to the Ice Court. If she is to take my advice, I fear she will need convincing. Word has reached the Ice Court of my coming, and an audience in her throne room has been granted.

Once more you have been summoned by the Motherland to protect its folk against the predations of Chaos. There will be no help from the south, for the Empire revels in its own strife, so Kislev must look to its own kith and kin. This is fortunate, for your daughter is on the throne and the Great Orthodoxy has risen to become a powerful defence against the Dark Powers. They must unite under you and the auspices of the Great Bear, and together the Daemons can be excised from Mother Kislev!

Kislev. The bulwark against the darkness. Yet the Motherland suffers, severed from its god.\\n\\nIf it is to survive, the nation needs its saviour once more. The folk of Kislev think Boris Bokha dead, but his body was claimed by the Motherland, and he has slept in ice ever since. Yet Ursun's pained roar will surely have started to rouse the Red Tzar.\\n\\nI journey to him now. He lays at a sacred site hidden by the Great Orthodoxy, deep in the cold oblasts of Kislev. If anyone can save the Bear-God of Kislev, it is Ursun's High Priest... Raddi Bokha... Boris Ursus.\\n\\nBut even should I manage to wake him, I will need to make a strong case that he should listen to me.

Cathay has been left to fester for over a century. Left leaderless and devoid of the healing aura of the Moon Empress, it is ripe for experimentation. First, the bulwark that guards Grand Cathay must be shattered. Ally with other servants of the Chaos Gods, dominate them if you must, and then break through the Great Bastion to spread your glorious gifts.

Decay and rot. Nurgle is the God of Plagues and poxes, and while the countless mortals suffer in misery, He believes to have bestowed them all with great gifts. Nurgle's most eager apprentice is the Foetid Brewmaster, Ku'gath Plaguefather.\\n\\nThe Plaguefather has always preferred lurking in the dark places of the mortal world, so it is no surprise that he was far from the Realm of Chaos when Ursun's roar caused the maelstrom. But there is a way to lure him back there... the promise of the ultimate specimen upon which to experiment.\\n\\nFor a time he was well hidden, even from the Tome of Fate's pages, and I wandered needlessly until I picked up his noxious trail and it led me underground. I must make my offer quickly, before I succumb...

The Maw sends you visions of Cathay, the land of the Astromancers. The Dragon King and Queen have flown away. Their nation is weak. Yet there is opportunity to profit if we work for the Dragons. The Dark Gods too offer riches if we help them topple the mountain-wall. Plenty of meat no matter which side we choose. The Maw cares not which banner you fight under, if any. The visions starts to coalesce: a chance to expand the Mouth-God’s influence beyond the mountains and see Ogre-kind thrive...

The Ogre Kingdoms, a group of greedy, brutish tribes that fight with each other over riches and meat, are found in the east across the Mountains of Mourn. Oft-times, their violence spills out beyond the mountains, and so the Ogres roam far, occasionally even welcomed as mercenaries.\\n\\nSkrag, the Prophet of the Great Maw, is such a wanderer, and that is why he makes such an ideal candidate for this quest.\\n\\nI trek across the Chaos Wastes, avoiding the slave patrols in the Dark Lands, and at last reach the Ogre Kingdoms. I fear I will not have long to make my case before the audience get hungry.

The Dragon Emperor is long gone and so you – the Overtyrant – never one to look a gift Rhinox in the jaw, sense an opportunity… While Daemon and human scrap with each other, you are shrewd enough to sell the services of your Maneaters and Bulls to the highest bidder. It’s time to make a killing – quite literally!

The Ogre Kingdoms sprawl across the Mountains of Mourn. They have taken the peaks from the now-extinct Sky-titans. This mountainous realm is a place of rocks, bones and great beasts to be eaten or tamed.\\n\\nPerhaps 'kingdoms' is a misnomer, for there is no king, but an Overtyrant who rules with an iron fist and demands tribute from the other tribes in the form of meat and gold. He is Greasus Goldtooth.\\n\\nI travel far, for the Mountains of Mourn are beyond the Dark Lands, in the east. This gives me time to ruminate on how to approach them, and convince the Overtyrant to invade the Chaos Realms. Avarice is the key, for there is no one greedier than Greasus!
The great Bear-God of Kislev is missing. Prayers go unanswered and the roar of spring has not been heard. Prince Yuri is sent north by the Tzarina Katarin to search for Kislev’s lost god.

The She-Dragon and her Celestial Emperor have fled, leaving their nest of souls – what mortals call "Cathay" – painfully exposed. Now is the time to sample an eastern menu, majestic tempter. First you must dominate the supplicant legions of rival Gods, and then thrust them toward the Great Bastion, breach it and consume the screaming souls of Grand Cathay.

The Chaos God of desire, Slaanesh, is the youngest of the Dark Powers, but has the potential to eclipse them all. He is the Dark Prince and Lord of Excess. His servants embody those traits to perfection, and none more so than N'Kari, the Arch-tempter.\\n\\nHis search for the exquisite saw him stranded on the wrong side of the maelstrom. Not that the Keeper of Secrets would be concerned, for a being such as N'Kari will always find... distractions.\\n\\nNevertheless, I can perhaps offer a greater prize to tempt the Arch-tempter.\\n\\nI make my way through perfumed fog – ignoring the tormented screams – to his palace. The negotiations will be challenging.
Pathetic! You were no challenge for Khorne's servants. Remember, without the Daemon Prince's soul, the Forge of Souls cannot be reached.

You breached the Brass Citadel, a feat so rare as to draw Khorne’s gaze! Whether that is in ire or respect is yet to be known, for a long shadow is cast over your mighty victory, as Be’lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the first soul, but three more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You breached the Brass Citadel, a feat so rare as to draw Khorne’s gaze! Whether that is in ire or respect is yet to be known, for a long shadow is cast over your mighty victory, as Be’lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the second soul, but two more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You breached the Brass Citadel, a feat so rare as to draw Khorne’s gaze! Whether that is in ire or respect is yet to be known, for a long shadow is cast over your mighty victory, as Be’lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the third soul, but one more is required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You breached the Brass Citadel, a feat so rare as to draw Khorne’s gaze! Whether that is in ire or respect is yet to be known, but you now have all the souls required to reach the Forge of Souls. Muster your greatest force, but do not tarry, for Be'lakor awaits. Prepare for the ultimate battle!
The maelstrom dissipates. The wars recede, but peace is only ever fleeting. After all, kingdoms rise and fall, but only the greatest can make Immortal Empires…
For now you retreat and regroup, but fate is a fickle thing – there might be a chance to return. Remember, without the Daemon Prince's soul, the Forge of Souls cannot be reached.

You have done the impossible by desecrating Tzeentch's fortress and charting his labyrinth. The Changer of Ways notes your success even if it is with contempt, but he is not the only schemer whose machinations are coming to fruition... Be'lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the first soul, but three more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You have done the impossible by desecrating Tzeentch's fortress and charting his labyrinth. The Changer of Ways notes your success even if it is with contempt, but he is not the only schemer whose machinations are coming to fruition... Be'lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the second soul, but two more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You have done the impossible by desecrating Tzeentch's fortress and charting his labyrinth. The Changer of Ways notes your success even if it is with contempt, but he is not the only schemer whose machinations are coming to fruition... Be'lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the third soul, but one more is required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You have done the impossible by desecrating Tzeentch's fortress and charting his labyrinth. The Changer of Ways notes your success even if it is with contempt. You now have all the souls required to reach the Forge of Souls. Muster your greatest force, but do not tarry, for Be'lakor awaits. Prepare for the ultimate battle!
You have fallen victim to the infection of cowardice. Go and wallow in defeat. Remember, without the Daemon Prince's soul, the Forge of Souls cannot be reached.

The Plague Lord's mansion has been sundered! The God of Decay begrudgingly concedes your might, but will no doubt already be concocting a new disease to blight your empire in retaliation. Still, Be'lakor remains the most pressing threat. You have the first soul, but three more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

The Plague Lord's mansion has been sundered! The God of Decay begrudgingly concedes your might, but will no doubt already be concocting a new disease to blight your empire in retaliation. Still, Be'lakor remains the most pressing threat. You have the second soul, but two more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

The Plague Lord's mansion has been sundered! The God of Decay begrudgingly concedes your might, but will no doubt already be concocting a new disease to blight your empire in retaliation. Still, Be'lakor remains the most pressing threat. You have the third soul, but one more is required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

The Plague Lord's mansion has been sundered! The God of Decay begrudgingly concedes your might, and you now have all the souls required to reach the Forge of Souls. Muster your greatest force, but do not tarry, for Be'lakor awaits. Prepare for the ultimate battle!

Your desire wilted, but there are other challengers with stronger resolve who shall capture the Dark Prince's interest. Remember, without the Daemon Prince's soul, the Forge of Souls cannot be reached.

You have violated the Dark Prince's defences and defiled His palace. For but a fleeting moment, the Lord of Excess' attention is diverted to your victory. But Slaanesh will not be the only sinister entity to have noticed... Be’lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the first soul, but three more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You have violated the Dark Prince's defences and defiled His palace. For but a fleeting moment, the Lord of Excess' attention is diverted to your victory. But Slaanesh will not be the only sinister entity to have noticed... Be’lakor remains in the Forge of Souls with the prize. You have the second soul, but two more are required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You have violated the Dark Prince's defences and defiled His palace. For but a fleeting moment, the Lord of Excess' attention is diverted to your victory. But Slaanesh will not be the only sinister entity to have noticed... You have the third soul, but one more is required to light the Bridge of Shadows.

You have violated the Dark Prince's defences and defiled His palace. For but a fleeting moment, the Lord of Excess' attention is diverted to your victory. You now have all the souls required to reach the Forge of Souls. Muster your greatest force, but do not tarry, for Be'lakor awaits. Prepare for the ultimate battle!

The Dragon Emperor of Grand Cathay and his consort have been absent from their lands for over a century. Much to your consternation, even you do not know of their whereabouts, and the stygian depths within the Well of Eternity offer no hints. Even so, what is left unguarded should be stolen. Lead the Chaos invasion from without and fan the flames of unrest from within. Souls are a worthy prize, but Tzeentch craves knowledge above all – smother the eastern lands in the Changer’s corruption and the Dragon Emperor’s location will be revealed.

Tzeentch is the Great Architect, the Changer of the Ways, the God of magic, mischief and manipulation. Kairos Fateweaver is His oracle, able to see past and future but blind to the present.\\n\\nUrsun's death-howl has stranded Kairos on the mortal plane while he is in the midst of a grand scheme – an incursion into the Celestial Dragon Empire of Cathay. But there is a greater boon awaiting in the Chaos Realms, if he can bypass the maelstrom.\\n\\nI travel to reach Fateweaver at the Silvered Tower, hoping to be retained before he teleports to a staging post in the east. He will know of my coming.

Among those who study the obscure depths of the occult there are mages who walk the tenuous bounds between life and death. Throughout the cavernous courts of Nuln are whispers of one who exists within this nebulous realm of reality, regarded as an inhuman spectre of Unlife.\\n\\nElspeth von Draken, Magisterix of the Amethyst Order, steeps herself in Shyish and the mastery of the Lore of Death. Though many shun the wielders of the deathly arts, the “Graveyard Rose” is unquestioned in her steadfast defence of the Empire.\\n\\nHeeding her warnings of evil on the horizon, the Elector Countess of Wissenland has granted the pallid Sorceress access to the renowned might of the Imperial Gunnery School. Whether by her command of magic or the lethal guns of Nuln, the Empire’s enemies shall be granted death everlasting!
